articles.title: Global AI Race Shows Asia Leading as Stocks Start 2026 With Bang
articles.description: Asia’s technology stocks began 2026 on a tear, with investors betting their momentum and outperformance against US peers will last through the year.
articles.content:

articles.title: Bank of India bags 4 awards at IBA Banking Conference
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent JAMMU, Jan 10: Bank of India, one of India’s largest PSU banks, bagged four awards in the Digital and Technology domain today at 21st Annual Banking Technology Conference, Expo & Citations, organised by Indian Banks Association (IBA). The awards were conferred by T. Rabi Shankar, Deputy Governor, RBI, under the Public & Private Banks – Large Bank category. The Bank won the Runner-up Award for Fintech Collaboration and received Special Mentions under Best AI/ML, Best Tech Talent and […]

articles.title: Space tech companies hiring: Satcom boom, lower launch costs, resuable rocket tech driving up demand for skilled pros
articles.description: Industry executives say space tech firms are increeasingly looking for skilled talent as India is pushing to become a major player in the sector. Companies are strengthening teams in spacecraft hardware engineering, infrared and sensor capabilities, and mission operations as a booming satellite industry, declining launch costs and advances such as reusable rocket technology are further accelerating demand for skilled talent.
articles.content:

articles.title: Digital Dreams Vs Rural Realities
articles.description: Expectations of the Youth The Indian youth of 2026-represented by students across disciplines from Sanskrit to journalism have high expectations from the AI revolution. They are no longer satisfied with mere digital versions of textbooks; they seek a comprehensive ecosystem that offer Accessibility and Equity. Students in rural areas emphasize that while technology opens new worlds, it must be accompanied by reliable internet and affordable devices to prevent the digital divide from widening. 11 ravia.gupta@gmail.com As India moves steadily towards […]
articles.content:
Expectations of the Youth

articles.title: Dr Jitendra hosts informal luncheon get-together for journalists, media persons
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent NEW DELHI, Jan 10: Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Science and Technology; Earth Sciences and Minister of State for PMO, Department of Atomic Energy, Department of Space, Personnel, Public Grievances and Pensions, Dr. Jitendra Singh today hosted an informal luncheon get -together for journalists and media persons at his residence here today. The Minister has been, over the last one decade, hosting such periodic informal luncheon get-togethers for the media at his residence, from time to […]
